text: As I grab my identification, I hold it up and stare at it in the one beacon of light that breaks through the darkness of the damp alleyway.
In my fingers lies an elegant card, with “Dick Johnson : PRIVATE INVESTIGATOR”, printed in platinum Proxima Nova on sleek matte black cardstock
Perfect.
I place the card flat on the table, the blackness of the card contrasting with the table like ink in a water glass.
I set my legs across my stand and light a smoke, waiting in quiet anticipation for my first client.
Just as I prepared to doze off, a figure emerged walking down the alleyway, silhouetting the dull morning sun like an eclipsing moon.
As they got closer, I was able to give em a good look.
It appeared to be a dame who resembled some sort of tall reptile.
She looked a bit more humanoid than the folk that had been giving me the side eye from across the alley.
YOU!
speaker: natieks

text: YOU SCAMMER DETECTIVE!!
I WANT A REFUND!!!
speaker: natieks

text: ...Huh?
speaker: det

text: I don’t recall taking a case from you.
For that matter, I don’t even know who you are.
speaker: det

text: DON’T LIE, OF COURSE YOU REMEMBER ME!
speaker: natieks

text: I met you just a few days ago in the local bar and hired you to figure out who graffitied my house!!
I’d recognize that trenchcoat anywhere!!! And that dinky cowboy hat!!
speaker: natieks

text: The stranger points at my fedora as if to insinuate it’s a cowboy hat, an opinion as wrong as wearing socks in sandals.
I take another smoke to alleviate this newfound stress.
As I stare at the billowing gray fumes I think to myself, “Maybe this isn’t worth it”
and once again look down to face this
lady’s outstretched finger...
I sigh and collect myself. I need to make a good impression here if I want to expand my business, and more importantly I have a responsibility to help those in need.
There must be some sort of mistake. I only settled on this planet a few days ago; I haven’t received any jobs, let alone a reputation beyond “newcomer”.
speaker: det

text: For the sake of professionalism, I bite back the urge to also correct her remark on my “dinky cowboy hat.”
Addressing the false accusation was my highest priority; my livelihood was on the line.
Okay I guess the hat is a bit different from how I remembered it, but how do I know you’re not just lying to me or wearing a new hat!?
speaker: natieks

text: If what you said is true, it’s probable that there’s another detective in town that I wasn’t aware of…
some bloke who’s trying to tear down my business.
speaker: det

text: No, it could even be that they’re impersonating me.
speaker: det

text: While I lack solid evidence at the moment, if you gimme me some time, I’ll prove my innocence and uncover the true fraud.
speaker: det

text: If I fail to do so, well… I suppose I can compensate you for your losses.
Please, give me a chance.
speaker: det

text: ...Fine.
speaker: natieks

text: Since you make some good points, I’ll give you until the end of this day to figure out this… mess.
speaker: natieks

text: And if it turns out I was right and you’re actually just lying to me again, I’ll go on Relp™ to make sure your business ends before it even begins!!
speaker: natieks

text: When you’re done with your investigation, find me at the local bar…
speaker: natieks

text: I watch the back of my self-proclaimed customer strut back out the alleyway, deep in contemplation.
With only until the end of the day to clear my name, the investigation before me is daunting… but of course, far from impossible.
